dialog: Hello Medi, can you explain to me about the flu vaccine?
Sure. The flu vaccine is a yearly vaccine that helps protect against the flu virus. It is recommended for everyone over the age of 6 months.
How does the vaccine work?

The vaccine contains a weakened or inactive form of the flu virus that stimulates your body to produce antibodies to fight the virus. This helps your body recognize and fight the virus if you are exposed to it in the future.
Is the vaccine safe?
Yes, the vaccine is safe and has been used for many years. However, some people may experience mild side effects like soreness at the injection site, fever, and body aches.
Can you still get the flu even if you get the vaccine?
Yes, you can still get the flu even if you get the vaccine. However, the vaccine can reduce the severity of your symptoms if you do get sick.
Thanks for the information. Do I need a new vaccine every year?
